channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: SCA: Highly Efficient Semantic-Consistent Unrestricted Adversarial Attack
item.description: Unrestricted adversarial attacks typically manipulate the semantic content of an image (e. g., color or texture) to create adversarial examples that are both effective and photorealistic.

item.title: BadCM: Invisible Backdoor Attack Against Cross-Modal Learning
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a novel bilateral backdoor to fill in the missing pieces of the puzzle in the cross-modal backdoor and propose a generalized invisible backdoor framework against cross-modal learning (BadCM).

item.title: Dog-IQA: Standard-guided Zero-shot MLLM for Mix-grained Image Quality Assessment
item.description: Image quality assessment (IQA) serves as the golden standard for all models' performance in nearly all computer vision fields.

item.title: Diffusion Models are Evolutionary Algorithms
item.description: In a convergence of machine learning and biology, we reveal that diffusion models are evolutionary algorithms.

item.title: Deep Learning-Based Prediction of Suspension Dynamics Performance in Multi-Axle Vehicles
item.description: This paper presents a deep learning-based framework for predicting the dynamic performance of suspension systems in multi-axle vehicles, emphasizing the integration of machine learning with traditional vehicle dynamics modeling.

item.title: Hard Negative Sample Mining for Whole Slide Image Classification
item.description: Weakly supervised whole slide image (WSI) classification is challenging due to the lack of patch-level labels and high computational costs.

item.title: LLMs Know More Than They Show: On the Intrinsic Representation of LLM Hallucinations
item.description: In this work, we show that the internal representations of LLMs encode much more information about truthfulness than previously recognized.

item.title: BACKTIME: Backdoor Attacks on Multivariate Time Series Forecasting
item.description: Multivariate Time Series (MTS) forecasting is a fundamental task with numerous real-world applications, such as transportation, climate, and epidemiology.

item.title: Computer-aided Colorization State-of-the-science: A Survey
item.description: This paper reviews published research in the field of computer-aided colorization technology.

item.title: Custom Non-Linear Model Predictive Control for Obstacle Avoidance in Indoor and Outdoor Environments
item.description: Navigating complex environments requires Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs) and autonomous systems to perform trajectory tracking and obstacle avoidance in real-time.

item.title: Parameter Competition Balancing for Model Merging
item.description: Recently developed model merging techniques enable the direct integration of multiple models, each fine-tuned for distinct tasks, into a single model.

item.title: Towards Comprehensive Detection of Chinese Harmful Memes
item.description: Harmful memes have proliferated on the Chinese Internet, while research on detecting Chinese harmful memes significantly lags behind due to the absence of reliable datasets and effective detectors.

item.title: Diffusion-based Extreme Image Compression with Compressed Feature Initialization
item.description: Second, we design a novel relay residual diffusion that reconstructs the raw image by iteratively removing the added noise and the residual between the compressed and target latent features.

item.title: A Comprehensive Survey of Mamba Architectures for Medical Image Analysis: Classification, Segmentation, Restoration and Beyond
item.description: This review aims to demonstrate the transformative potential of Mamba in overcoming existing barriers within medical imaging while paving the way for innovative advancements in the field.

item.title: Med-TTT: Vision Test-Time Training model for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Medical image segmentation plays a crucial role in clinical diagnosis and treatment planning.

item.title: Deep Regression 2D-3D Ultrasound Registration for Liver Motion Correction in Focal Tumor Thermal Ablation
item.description: Therefore, we propose a 2D-3D US registration approach to enable intra-procedural alignment that mitigates errors caused by liver motion.

item.title: Mitigating Memorization In Language Models
item.description: Language models (LMs) can "memorize" information, i. e., encode training data in their weights in such a way that inference-time queries can lead to verbatim regurgitation of that data.

item.title: Traffic Light or Light Traffic? Investigating Phrasal Semantics in Large Language Models
item.description: Phrases are fundamental linguistic units through which humans convey semantics.

item.title: CodeJudge: Evaluating Code Generation with Large Language Models
item.description: This paper presents CodeJudge, a code evaluation framework that leverages LLMs to evaluate the semantic correctness of generated code without the need for test cases.

item.title: Channel-aware Contrastive Conditional Diffusion for Multivariate Probabilistic Time Series Forecasting
item.description: Then, we devise an ad-hoc denoising-based temporal contrastive learning to explicitly amplify the predictive mutual information between past observations and future forecasts.

item.title: How to Train Long-Context Language Models (Effectively)
item.description: We study continued training and supervised fine-tuning (SFT) of a language model (LM) to make effective use of long-context information.

item.title: Searching for Efficient Linear Layers over a Continuous Space of Structured Matrices
item.description: To analyze the framework, we develop a taxonomy of all such operators based on their computational and algebraic properties and show that differences in the compute-optimal scaling laws are mostly governed by a small number of variables that we introduce.

item.title: Measurements with Noise: Bayesian Optimization for Co-optimizing Noise and Property Discovery in Automated Experiments
item.description: We have developed a Bayesian optimization (BO) workflow that integrates intra-step noise optimization into automated experimental cycles.

item.title: An Efficient Inference Frame for SMLM (Single-Molecule Localization Microscopy)
item.description: Single-molecule localization microscopy (SMLM) surpasses the diffraction limit, achieving subcellular resolution.

item.title: General Preference Modeling with Preference Representations for Aligning Language Models
item.description: In this paper, we introduce preference representation learning, an approach that embeds responses into a latent space to capture intricate preference structures efficiently, achieving linear query complexity.

item.title: Collective Critics for Creative Story Generation
item.description: Generating a long story of several thousand words with narrative coherence using Large Language Models (LLMs) has been a challenging task.

item.title: Can Large Language Models Grasp Legal Theories? Enhance Legal Reasoning with Insights from Multi-Agent Collaboration
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) could struggle to fully understand legal theories and perform complex legal reasoning tasks.

item.title: CTARR: A fast and robust method for identifying anatomical regions on CT images via atlas registration
item.description: The method serves as a pre-processing step for any deep learning-based CT image analysis pipeline by automatically identifying the pre-defined anatomical region that is relevant for the follow-up task and removing the rest.

item.title: RelChaNet: Neural Network Feature Selection using Relative Change Scores
item.description: We introduce RelChaNet, a novel and lightweight feature selection algorithm that uses neuron pruning and regrowth in the input layer of a dense neural network.

item.title: ControlAR: Controllable Image Generation with Autoregressive Models
item.description: Firstly, we explore control encoding for AR models and propose a lightweight control encoder to transform spatial inputs (e. g., canny edges or depth maps) into control tokens.

item.title: ReLIC: A Recipe for 64k Steps of In-Context Reinforcement Learning for Embodied AI
item.description: Intelligent embodied agents need to quickly adapt to new scenarios by integrating long histories of experience into decision-making.

item.title: Agent Security Bench (ASB): Formalizing and Benchmarking Attacks and Defenses in LLM-based Agents
item.description: Our benchmark results reveal critical vulnerabilities in different stages of agent operation, including system prompt, user prompt handling, tool usage, and memory retrieval, with the highest average attack success rate of 84. 30\%, but limited effectiveness shown in current defenses, unveiling important works to be done in terms of agent security for the community.

item.title: Vinoground: Scrutinizing LMMs over Dense Temporal Reasoning with Short Videos
item.description: There has been growing sentiment recently that modern large multimodal models (LMMs) have addressed most of the key challenges related to short video comprehension.

item.title: Pseudo-Stereo Inputs: A Solution to the Occlusion Challenge in Self-Supervised Stereo Matching
item.description: The proposed pseudo-stereo inputs strategy, due to its simplicity and effectiveness, has the potential to serve as a new paradigm for direct self-supervised stereo matching.

item.title: AlphaEdit: Null-Space Constrained Knowledge Editing for Language Models
item.description: To address this, we introduce AlphaEdit, a novel solution that projects perturbation onto the null space of the preserved knowledge before applying it to the parameters.

item.title: Leray-Schauder Mappings for Operator Learning
item.description: We present an algorithm for learning operators between Banach spaces, based on the use of Leray-Schauder mappings to learn a finite-dimensional approximation of compact subspaces.

item.title: Extending Context Window of Large Language Models from a Distributional Perspective
item.description: However, existing scaling methods often rely on empirical approaches and lack a profound understanding of the internal distribution within RoPE, resulting in suboptimal performance in extending the context window length.

item.title: Statistical Taylor Expansion
item.description: Statistical Taylor expansion replaces the input precise variables in a conventional Taylor expansion with random variables each with known mean and deviation, to calculate the result mean and deviation.

item.title: MM-LDM: Multi-Modal Latent Diffusion Model for Sounding Video Generation
item.description: Sounding Video Generation (SVG) is an audio-video joint generation task challenged by high-dimensional signal spaces, distinct data formats, and different patterns of content information.

item.title: FlashMask: Efficient and Rich Mask Extension of FlashAttention
item.description: In this paper, we propose FlashMask, an extension of FlashAttention that introduces a column-wise sparse representation of attention masks.

item.title: Toward Zero-Shot Learning for Visual Dehazing of Urological Surgical Robots
item.description: In addition, we organize and propose a dehaze dataset for robotic vision in urological surgery (USRobot-Dehaze dataset).

item.title: Perceptual Piercing: Human Visual Cue-based Object Detection in Low Visibility Conditions
item.description: The findings offer a viable solution for enhancing object detection in poor visibility and contribute to the broader understanding of integrating human visual principles into deep learning algorithms for intricate visual recognition challenges.

item.title: Codev-Bench: How Do LLMs Understand Developer-Centric Code Completion?
item.description: Code completion, a key downstream task in code generation, is one of the most frequent and impactful methods for enhancing developer productivity in software development.

item.title: EUFCC-CIR: a Composed Image Retrieval Dataset for GLAM Collections
item.description: The intersection of Artificial Intelligence and Digital Humanities enables researchers to explore cultural heritage collections with greater depth and scale.

item.title: MiraGe: Editable 2D Images using Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Our approach improves the rendering quality and allows realistic image modifications, including human-inspired perception of photos in the 3D world.

item.title: Fake It Until You Break It: On the Adversarial Robustness of AI-generated Image Detectors
item.description: While generative AI (GenAI) offers countless possibilities for creative and productive tasks, artificially generated media can be misused for fraud, manipulation, scams, misinformation campaigns, and more.

item.title: EAB-FL: Exacerbating Algorithmic Bias through Model Poisoning Attacks in Federated Learning
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new type of model poisoning attack, EAB-FL, with a focus on exacerbating group unfairness while maintaining a good level of model utility.

item.title: A Spark of Vision-Language Intelligence: 2-Dimensional Autoregressive Transformer for Efficient Finegrained Image Generation
item.description: This work tackles the information loss bottleneck of vector-quantization (VQ) autoregressive image generation by introducing a novel model architecture called the 2-Dimensional Autoregression (DnD) Transformer.

item.title: Depth Pro: Sharp Monocular Metric Depth in Less Than a Second
item.description: We present a foundation model for zero-shot metric monocular depth estimation.

item.title: Integrating Visual and Textual Inputs for Searching Large-Scale Map Collections with CLIP
item.description: Despite the prevalence and historical importance of maps in digital collections, current methods of navigating and exploring map collections are largely restricted to catalog records and structured metadata.
